basics.name: Stefan Eduardo LÃ¼tschg Espinosa
basics.label: Biomedical Engineering
basics.summary: Stefan hails from Santiago, Chile and Miami, Florida. He is currently in his second year at Boston University working on his Bachelor of Science Degree in Biomedical Engineering.

work.summary: The goal of research in the Brain and Vision Research Laboratory is to understand the mechanisms mediating human visual perception in healthy and damaged human brain, long-term plasticity and short-term dynamics in networks of the adult normal and damaged (from stroke) cortex by using interactively multimodal imaging (fMRI, MEG), psychophysics, and biologically constrained computational modeling.
highlights: Currently working on a psychophysical experiment involving Visually Guided Navigation using the Unity 3D game engine and C#.
The goal of this experiment is to be able to use it with medical imaging techniques such as MEG.

volunteer.summary: Global movement of free coding clubs for young people.

publications.name: Video compression for 3d media
publications.summary: Innovative middle-out compression algorithm that changes the way we store data.

references.name: Erlich Bachman
references.reference: It is my pleasure to recommend Richard, his performance working as a consultant for Main St. Company proved that he will be a valuable addition to any company.
